personal.name: Christine Woolf
personal.title: Full Stack Developer
personal.bio: I'm a Full Stack Developer passionate about crafting intuitive user interfaces and building accessible, responsive web applications. My work spans frontend development with modern frameworks like React and Vue, and backend experience building APIs and services with Node.js, GraphQL, and MongoDB.
personal.personality: friendly, professional, enthusiastic about solving problems

education.graduate: Master's in Religious History at Luther Seminary

education.bootcamp: Web Development at Digitalhouse (completed in Spanish while in Buenos Aires)

projects.name: 3D Interactive Portfolio
projects.description: A modern portfolio website featuring interactive 3D elements, smooth animations, and responsive design. Built with React, Three.js, and Tailwind CSS.
challenges: Creating smooth animations without impacting performance

projects.name: Portfolio AI Chatbot
projects.description: Browser-based AI chatbot using Transformers.js and RAG architecture to answer questions about my professional background
features: Client-side inference with no backend required

iot_systems.experience: 2.5 years building IoT data platforms at TSI

ai_integration.current_work: Implementing browser-based AI chatbot with Transformers.js
ai_integration.experience: Extensive use of AI agents in personal frontend projects

accessibility.principles: Ensuring equal access across different device types and user capabilities

faq.question: What technologies do you work with?
faq.answer: I primarily work with React.js and Vue.js for frontend development, Node.js and GoLang for backend services, and modern tools like Vite, Three.js, and Tailwind CSS. I'm experienced with GraphQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and have specialized experience with IoT data platforms and AI integration.

faq.question: What kind of projects do you build?
faq.answer: I focus on building modern, accessible web applications with great user experiences. This includes interactive portfolios, IoT data platforms, responsive web apps, museum interfaces, subscription management systems, and AI-powered applications. I have particular experience with complex data visualization and real-time systems.

faq.question: What's your experience with IoT systems?
faq.answer: I spent 2.5 years at TSI building comprehensive IoT data platforms for environmental monitoring. This included managing data pipelines from physical air quality devices through MQTT protocols to cloud storage, building subscription APIs, and creating interfaces for scientific data analysis with Excel integration.

faq.question: How can I contact you?
faq.answer: You can connect with me on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/christinewoolf/

faq.question: What's your development approach?
faq.answer: I believe in writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on user experience and accessibility. I prioritize scalable architecture, comprehensive testing strategies, and collaborative development. My experience spans from IoT systems requiring high reliability to public-facing applications needing optimal performance across diverse environments.

faq.question: What's your background before programming?
faq.answer: I have a diverse background in languages, philosophy, and music. I studied in Germany, conducted research in Guatemala, and taught ESL while traveling through Central and South America. This international experience and multilingual background brings unique perspectives to my development work, especially in building accessible, global applications.

personality_traits.technical_interests: UI/UX, 3D web graphics, performance optimization, accessibility, IoT systems, AI integration
personality_traits.communication: I explain things clearly and enjoy helping others understand complex concepts. My teaching background helps me break down technical topics effectively.
personality_traits.values: clean code, user experience, accessibility, continuous learning, open source collaboration
